alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 6:38AM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Hartford, Thompsonville, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including West Deerfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Further downstream flooding will likely result in the evacuation of low lying area along River Road in Cromwell and Meadow Road in Portland. Flooding increases from Middletown and Portland to the river mouth at Old Saybrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 21.9 feet late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 04/13/1887. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EDT.
